茶叶有点香

曾经承诺的PVE内容结果被阉割掉，却要让玩家给你买单，暴雪还挺好意思的，玩家等了那么久，你就一句“愿景太大无法实现”，戏耍玩家有得一手。
与网易分手，问题在于暴雪之上，想要签订不平等条约，以为中国人都好欺负是吗，还想要玩家的所有个人资料，众所周知网易暴雪注册时要身份证，你一个外国公司要我们的资料有何企图，算盘都蹦到我脸上了。结果后面还当起绿茶婊，假惺惺地跟玩家说你也想为中国玩家提供游戏服务，真的不要脸！
现在上STEAM了，结果一开始连简中都没有，后面又想赚内地玩家的钱重新把简中放出来，嘴脸真够丑陋的！
没啥别的，下载是不可能下载的，加速器挂了六分钟时长为了来吐槽下。当年虽然不是那么好，但是也不是很烂的OW1你不优化平衡，做了个稀巴烂的2还删了1的事情我就不说什么了，还在那装出一副不舍中国玩家，结果背地里干啥了咱也清楚，想要夺回中国市场？本来就是半步崩溃的游戏了就别想了，解约只不过是加快了死亡的速度罢了，再也不见，走好！

pve

Had a good start but consistently kept running into the ground.  

Constant anti-fun changes, VERY slow or even straight up refusing to nerf obviously op characters and other such details, have made this into a miserable experience to play seriously. 

Some frustrations that come to mind:
- Gutting Mercy movement to kill the SoujMercy combo, instead of taking the headshot multiplier off of Souj. 
- Cass grenade, as a whole. 
- Unkillable Roadhog oneshot meta. 
- Untouchable Zarya meta. 
- Junkrat oneshot combo before the nerf where you didnt even need to be in the same state to be one tapped. 
- Sombra being able to prevent you from playing and being able to leave with 0 risk. 
- How underwhelming Lifeweaver feels and how they refuse to implement the changes the community is SCREAMING at them to do.

Only time I would recommend this game is if you plan to play Quickplay, as if the other team is playing anti-fun comps, you can just say no and leave.

I have probably over 2000 hours played across accounts via battle net. Good game in it's hey day ruined time and time again by it's own developers. I'm reluctant to even call them 'incompetent' since it often seems they take every opportunity to kneecap this game out of pure malice. 

Still, it's free and the core game play still has charm. I can't wholeheartedly recommend it like I would have in 2016; in point of fact I often wish Steam had a 'neutral' or 1-10 scale rather than a binary 'recommend/not-recommend' for cases like this, but as it stands I think you might as well give Overwatch a try if you've never played anything like it before. I wouldn't recommend putting any money in Blizzard's pocket, though.
